title.narrative: Morocco II-Compact

description.narrative:
MCC's $450 million Morocco Employability and Land Compact supports two Moroccan Government priorities that will contribute to economic growth and investment in the country: employability and land productivity.
Morocco's economic and political stability has contributed to continuous economic growth and significant poverty reduction over the past decade. Although poverty trends are improving, regional inequality remains considerable, with an urban/rural divide in access to public services and economic opportunities. Morocco has critically low rates of gender equality and one of the lowest female labor force participation rates in the world. By supporting policy and institutional changes that will improve Morocco's investment environment and by creating models for engagement with the private sector, the Employability and Land Compact address both the supply and demand sides of the labor market.
The Government of Morocco is strongly committed to carrying out these policy and institutional reforms and will make a financial contribution of more than 15 percent toward the compact.

condition.narrative: Not later than 20 days (or such other period of time as may be agreed by MCC) prior to the commencement of each Disbursement Period. Evidence required, Signed Disbursement Request with attachment.Disbursement Request, with attached Periodic Reports and supporting documentation, including:11.1. Narrative Report11.2. Quarterly Financial Report11.3. Detailed Financial Plan11.4. Procurement Performance Report11.5. Indicator Tracking Table11.6. Conditions Precedent Report11.7. Annual Supplemental Report

Prior to Initial Disbursement if not previously delivered, MCA-Morocco II delivers to MCC a copy of the official bulletin publishing both the law creating MCA-Morocco II and the decree for application of the law creating MCA-Morocco II. Evidence Required, copies of the law and decree creating MCA-Morocco as published in the official bulletin.
Prior to Initial Disbursement, MCA-Morocco has developed a complete Implementation Plan.

Prior to any Disbursement for investment in infrastructure or equipment in Region 1 of the Integrated School Improvement Model sub-Activity. Prior to any Disbursement for investment in infrastructure or equipment in Region 1 of the Integrated School Improvement Model sub-Activity, the Higher Council on Education, Training, and Scientific Research and the Ministry of National Education and Vocational Training, will appoint a steering committee and operational team, and will establish a plan for the re-design, preparation for, and implementation of a national student assessment ("PNEA"), as shall be memorialized in an Implementation Letter between the Government and MCC.

Prior to any Disbursement of Program Funding on or after the commencement of year five (5) of the Compact Term. Prior to any Disbursement of Program Funding on or after the commencement of year five (5) of the Compact Term, the Government must have submitted to MCC an initial draft Compact Closure Plan in accordance with the MCC Program Closure Guidelines.
Prior to each Disbursement, Activities to be funded with such Disbursement will not violate any applicable law or regulation.

Prior to each Disbursement, All Government entities involved in the implementation of the Program, including the Implementing Entities, are coordinating successfully with MCA-Morocco II and dedicating the necessary staff and other resources to ensure successful implementation of the Program.
Prior to each Disbursement, Fiscal Agent Disbursement Certificate. Evidence required, signed certificate.
Prior to each Disbursement, MCA Disbursement Certificate. Evidence required, Signed certificate.

Prior to each Disbursement, No material breach of any covenant, obligation or responsibility by the Government, MCA-Morocco II or any Government entity has occurred and is continuing under the Compact, this Agreement or any other Supplemental Agreement.
Prior to each Disbursement, Procurement Agent Disbursement Certificate. Evidence required, signed certificate.

Prior to each Disbursement, There has been progress satisfactory to MCC on the M&E Plan and Social and Gender Integration Plan for the Program, relevant Project or Activity and substantial compliance with the requirements of the M&E Plan and Social and Gender Integration Plan (including the targets set forth therein and any applicable reporting requirements set forth therein for the relevant Disbursement Period.
Prior to each Disbursement, copies of any reports from technical (including environmental) auditors delivered since previous Disbursement Request.

Prior to each Disbursement. Any Taxes paid with MCC Funding through the date ninety (90) days prior to the start of the applicable Disbursement Period have been reimbursed by the Government in full in accordance with Section 2.8(c) of the Compact.
Prior to each Disbursement. Each of the Key Staff remains engaged, or if a position is vacant, MCA-Morocco II is actively engaged, to MCC's satisfaction, in recruiting a replacement.

Prior to each Disbursement. MCA-Morocco II has complied in all material respects with its obligations set forth in Section 2.1(d) with respect to the establishment of a Bid Challenge System and its obligations set forth in Section 2.3 with respect to the establishment of an M&E Plan.

Prior to each Disbursement. MCC does not have grounds for concluding that any matter certified to it in the related MCA Disbursement Certificate, Procurement Agent Disbursement Certificate or Fiscal Agent Disbursement Certificate is not as certified.

Prior to each Disbursement. No act, omission, condition, or event has occurred that would be the basis for MCC to suspend or terminate, in whole or in part, the Compact or MCC Funding in accordance with Section 5.1 of the Compact

Prior to each Disbursement. The Government has complied in all material respects with its obligations set forth in Section 2.13 with respect to the making of its contributions in accordance with the projected timeline set forth in Annex III.

Prior to each Disbursement. The Government has satisfied all of its payment obligations, including any insurance, indemnification, tax payments or other obligations, and contributed all resources required from it, under the Compact, this Agreement and any other Supplemental Agreement.

Prior to each Disbursement. There has been no material negative finding in any financial audit report delivered in accordance with the Compact and Audit Plan, for the prior two quarters (or such other period as the Audit Plan may require).
Prior to the Initial Disbursement, adoption of Fiscal Accountability Plan. Evidence required, certified copy of MCA board resolutions approving plan together with copy of plan
Prior to the Initial Disbursement, compact entered into force. Evidence required, exchange of Letters from Principal Reps per Compact.
Prior to the Initial Disbursement, each of the Key Staff has been selected and engaged by MCA-Morocco II and approved by MCC. Evidence required, certified copies of all signed employment agreements

Prior to the initial CIF Disbursement, MCC has not determined, in its sole discretion, that an act, omission, condition, or event has occurred that would be the basis for MCC to suspend or terminate, in whole or in part, this Compact or MCC Funding in accordance with Section 5.1 of this Compact (Termination; Suspension).

Prior to the initial CIF Disbursement, MCC must be satisfied, in its sole discretion, that (i) the activities being funded with such CIF Disbursement are necessary, advisable or otherwise consistent with the goal of facilitating the implementation of this Compact and will not violate any applicable law or regulation; (ii) no material default or breach of any covenant, obligation or responsibility by the Government, MCA-Morocco II or any Government entity has occurred and is continuing under this Compact or any Supplemental Agreement; (iii) there has been no violation of, and the use of requested funds for the purposes requested will not violate, the limitations on use or treatment of MCC Funding set forth in Section 2.7 (Limitation on the Use of MCC Funding) of this Compact or in any applicable law or regulation; (iv) any Taxes paid with MCC Funding through the date 90 days prior to the start of the applicable Disbursement Period have been reimbursed by the Government in full in accordance with Section 2.8(c) (the Government will refund promptly MCC if a Tax has been paid contrary to the requirements of Section 2.8(a)) of this Compact; and (v) the Government has satisfied all of its payment obligations, including any insurance, indemnification, tax payments or other obligations, and contributed all resources required from it, under this Compact and any Supplemental Agreement.
Prior to the initial CIF Disbursement, The GoM (or MCA) has delivered to MCC a CIF Procurement plan acceptable to MCC.
Prior to the initial CIF Disbursement, The GoM (or MCA) has delivered to MCC an interim fiscal accountability plan acceptable to MCC.

Prior to the initial CIF Disbursement, appointment of an entity or individual to provide fiscal agent services, as approved by MCC, the Government must provide to MCC a true and complete copy of a Fiscal Agent Agreement, duly executed and in full force and effect, and the fiscal agent engaged thereby is mobilized.

Prior to the initial CIF Disbursement, appointment of an entity or individual to provide procurement agent services, as approved by MCC, the Government must provide to MCC a true and complete copy of the Procurement Agent Agreement, duly executed and in full force and effect, and the procurement agent engaged thereby is mobilized.

Prior to the initial CIF Disbursement, for any CIF Disbursement occurring after this Compact has entered into force in accordance with Article 7 (Entry Into Force): MCC must be satisfied, in its sole discretion, that (1) MCC has received copies of any reports due from any technical consultants (including environmental auditors engaged by MCA-Morocco II) for any Activity since the previous Disbursement Request, and all such reports are in form and substance satisfactory to MCC; (2) the Implementation Plan Documents and Fiscal Accountability Plan are current and updated and are in form and substance satisfactory to MCC, and there has been progress satisfactory to MCC on the components of the Implementation Plan for any relevant Projects or Activities related to such CIF Disbursement; (3) there has been progress satisfactory to MCC on the M&E Plan and Social and Gender Integration Plan for the Program or relevant Project or Activity and substantial compliance with the requirements of the M&E Plan and Social and Gender Integration Plan (including the targets set forth therein and any applicable reporting requirements set forth therein for the relevant Disbursement Period); (4) there has been no material negative finding in any financial audit report delivered in accordance with this Compact and the Audit Plan, for the prior two quarters (or such other period as the Audit Plan may require); (5) MCC does not have grounds for concluding that any matter certified to it in the related MCA Disbursement Certificate, the Fiscal Agent Disbursement Certificate or the Procurement Agent Disbursement Certificate is not as certified; and (vi) if any of the officers or key staff of MCA-Morocco II have been removed or resigned and the position remains vacant, MCA-Morocco II is actively engaged in recruiting a replacement.

Prior to the initial CIF Disbursement, if any proceeds of the CIF Disbursement are to be deposited in a bank account, MCC must receive satisfactory evidence that (i) the Bank Agreement has be executed, and (ii) the Permitted Accounts have been established.

Prior to the initial CIF Disbursement, the Government (or MCA) has delivered to MCC a completed Disbursement Request, together with the applicable Periodic Reports, for the applicable Disbursement Period, all in accordance with the Reporting Guidelines and in form and substance satisfactory to MCC.

Prior to the initial CIF Disbursement, the Government (or MCA) has delivered to MCC certificate of the Government (or MCA), dated as of the date of the CIF Disbursement Request, in such form as provided by MCC and in form and substance satisfactory to MCC.

Prior to the initial CIF Disbursement, the Government (or MCA) has delivered to MCC, if a Fiscal Agent has been engaged, a Fiscal Agent Disbursement Certificate, in form and substance satisfactory to MCC.

Prior to the initial CIF Disbursement, the Government (or MCA) has delivered to MCC, if a Procurement Agent has been engaged, a Procurement Agent Disbursement Certificate, in form and substance satisfactory to MCC.

Prior to the initial CIF Disbursement, the Government will have enacted such regulations as necessary to ensure that all MCC Funding is free from the payment or imposition of any existing or future taxes, duties, levies, contributions or other similar charges of or in Morocco (Section 2.8 of the Compact).

Prior to the initial Disbursement of MCC Funding for payment under a particular works or construction contract for a given Project or Activity. Prior to the initial Disbursement of MCC Funding for payment under a particular works or construction contract for a given Project or Activity, MCA-Morocco II must have submitted to MCC evidence in form and substance satisfactory to MCC that MCA-Morocco II or the appropriate Government entity has developed and adopted, as relevant, an Environmental and Social Impact Assessment ("ESIA"), an Environmental and Social Management Plan ("ESMP"), and/or a Resettlement Action Plan ("RAP") with respect to such Activity, each of which must be in form and substance satisfactory to MCC.

Prior to the initial Disbursement of MCC Funding for payment under a particular works or construction contract for a given Project or Activity. Prior to the initial Disbursement of MCC Funding for payment under a particular works or construction contract for a given Project or Activity, MCA-Morocco II must have submitted to MCC evidence in form and substance satisfactory to MCC that MCA-Morocco II or the appropriate Government entity is implementing the requirements of each ESIA, ESMP, Health and Safety Management Plan ("HSMP") or RAP, as appropriate, in all material respects and consistent with the MCC Environmental Guidelines (including the IFC Performance Standards that are incorporated by reference therein).

Prior to the initial Disbursement of Program Funding for each sub-Activity. Prior to the initial Disbursement of Program Funding for each sub-Activity, MCA-Morocco II and all appropriate Government entities will have signed any Implementing Entity Agreements relevant for the specific sub-Activity receiving funds.

Prior to the second Disbursement of Program Funding. Prior to the second Disbursement of Program Funding, MCA-Morocco II will have developed and approved a comprehensive Social and Gender Integration Plan, in form and substance satisfactory to MCC.

The Implementation Plan Documents and Fiscal Accountability Plan are current and updated and are in form and substance satisfactory to MCC, and there has been progress satisfactory to MCC on the components of the Implementation Plan including the Work Plan, Detailed Financial Plan, Audit Plan, and Procurement Plan, for any relevant Projects or Activities related to such Disbursement.
